name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure this mix design has been registered and is approved by Superintendent prior to laying mix.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Correspondence of receipt of mix design
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Superintendent approval, Completed ITP
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer/ Asphalt Supervisor / Superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Surface on which asphalt is to be placed is essentially dry and free from puddles and defects (holes, cracks, unstable material and edge irregularities) and loose materials.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The majority of the surface area to be paved has a temperature greater than or equal to the following:
○ Base & Intermediate Courses: 5°C for conventional binders or 10°C for PMBs & Class 600
○ Wearing Courses: 10°C for conventional binders or 15°C for PMBs
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Runs to be marked to ensure placement of joints satisfy the following unless otherwise approved by the Client:
○ Transverse Joints Offset from layer to layer by at least 2m
○ Longitudinal Joints Offset from layer to layer by at least 150mm and be within 300mm of the lane line or centre of lane. Wearing course shall be on lane lines.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec Cl.407.21 (b) & (c) Pavement Drawings
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Measure and mark out runs by tape measure or survey
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where new pavement abuts an existing pavement, the existing pavement shall be removed in steps to achieve an offset from layer to layer of not less than 150mm.
○ Depth of step to be cut to the full depth of each indiviual layer.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec Cl.407.21 (c) Project Specs. Section 3040.06 (d)(vii)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The placement of asphalt on the sub-base or granular base for a new pavement or for an overlay of an existing bituminous surfaced pavement shall not commence until the consent to proceed is obtained from the Client.
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer/ Asphalt Supervisor / Superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Check correct mix design as per pavement design has been delivered prior to laying mix. Asphalt mix shall be 10H in accorande with Yarra Trams Track Structure standard drawing.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Visual Inspection & Delivery Docket
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Delivery docket, Completed ITP
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Asphalt is not segregated, binder is not separated or does not contain uncoated particles and the temperature from mixing plant is not more than 175°C.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec Cl.407.20 Table 407.111
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ability to locate asphalt test results placed in three dimensions i.e. start/end chainage, offset/lane and layer
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Fulton Hogan Quality Plan
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Daily Lot Record
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Thickness of asphalt layer conforms to asphalt thickness on drawings or specifications
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec Cl.407.27 (a) & (b) Drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Dips using ruler or dip stick
FREQUENCY: During paving and after final roll
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The finished surface of asphalt wearing course shall be of uniform appearance, free of dragged areas, cracks, open textured patches and roller marks
2.7 Alignment of layers not placed against concrete edge
FREQUENCY: During paving and at completion of work
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The edge of asphalt layers shall not be more than 50mm inside nor more than 100mm outside, the designed offset from centreline or design line.
○ The rate of change of offset of the edge of layer shall not be greater than 25mm in 10m
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec Cl.407.29 (a)(iv) Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: For wearing course layers <50mm, if characteristic density ratio is:
○ 91.0% to 93.9% Lot may be accepted at reduced rate
○ Wearing course shall be tested at a frequency of 6 per lot, where the lot is either of 4000m2 or one days production
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer/ FH Lab Technician
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
ITP-021 - Construction of Track in Ballast Sections
template name: ITP-021 - Construction of Track in Ballast Sections Rev 0

name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and contractors are using the most current and complete set of drawings
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Design Drawings and Register
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Check rail surface is free from any profile deformation and is straight, no crippled or deformed rail is to be used
○ Ensure rail jewellery is of sound condition
○ Ensure ballast is clean, free from clay, dirt and other deleterious matter or weathered pieces of rock and free of dust.

○ Ensure ballast has been tested for conformity by a NATA certified laboratory and the results have been documented and recorded. On-site testing shall be completed for the particle size and shape of the ballast used.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ballast track construction shall not be carried out over any length of formation until the formation has been checked and approved by the superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Special Works is any trackwork which must be pre-fabricated (ie bent or assembled) before it can be installed on site. This includes all switches, crossings and any trackwork which needs pre-bending.
○ Ensure that all rails for crossing work is head hardened, and the appropriate weld kits and welding methods are adopted for welding modules and seperate rails.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Rails for curved trackwork, i.e. radius less than 150 m, shall be head hardened and pre-bent.
○ Additional 25 mm diameter tie bar holes may need to be drilled or cut into the web of the rails.
○ This is to allow installation of additional tie bars between the rails to ensure correct gauge can be maintained during concreting.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Welders shall be trained and compliant in Aluminothermic Welding Requirements;
○ TLIW3015 Weld Rails using Aluminothermic welding process
○ TLIW3035 Heat & cut materials using oxy-LPG equipment for the rail industry
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ultrasonic testers shall be trained and qualified to AINDT Technician level and shall be experienced in rail weld testing. Certification shall be provided to and approved by the Superintendent prior to commencement of testing.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to laying sleepers, 50mm Ballast shall be placed, graded and compacted in one or more layers to a total minimum depth of 150mm.
○ Compaction shall be by a smooth wheeled vibrating roller as specified for earthworks.
○ The superintendent shall inspect completed work prior to placement of sleepers.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete tramway sleepers shall be installed at 700mm intervals, tolerance of +/- 50mm in placement
○ Concrete tramway sleepers shall also comply with the design offsets at each chainage.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure rail strings conform to rail plan
○ All track work, including points and crossings shall confrom to alignment, offset, level and cant as per design drawings and track charts
○ Bottom of rail and bearing surface shall be clean of foreign materials before laying
○ Track Gauge shall be calibrated to 1435mm with a tolerance of +3mm , using an approved measuring device
○ Note: Cant shall be applied uniformly over transitions
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Completion of track charts
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Each sleeper shall be fastened to rail with approved jewellery and rail clips.
○ Clips shall be installed with panpuller or equivalent.
○ All fasteners shall be sealed as per agreed method with Yarra Trams.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: After track construction and prior to tamping, cribs and shoulers are to be filled to top of sleeper with extra ballast.
○ All sleepers shall be lifted, lined and tamped after installation and fastening of rails.
○ The depth of ballast following tamping shall be 200mm from top of sub ballast to bottom of sleepers.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Rails shall be saw cut or flame cut
○ Minimum closure length from proximity of welds shall be 3m
○ Rail end conditions shall match (i.e flame cut - flame cut)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Joints shall be square across the track
○ Maximum skew at square joints shall be 65mm
○ Portions shall match rail type (i.e HHR, Ordinary)
— 1.5m of a glued insulation joint assembly
○ Field welds shall be +/- 50mm from centre of bay between sleepers
○ Weld Return forms shall be completed by qualified welder
○ Welds shall be grinded after 1 hour
○ Welds shall be free of water
○ Post grinding, welds shall be cleaned for visual inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The weld shall be ground smooth to the exact rail head profile after it has sufficiently cooled (not earlier than one hour after pouring). The grinding stroke should not exceed 500 mm to each side of the weld.
○ Welds shall be cleaned of sand and cast metal residues to permit a thorough visual inspection.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where Tee Head Rails are used at special works, crossovers, or on curves up to 325m, check plates shall be fitted in accordance with Table 2 of the Yarra Trams Infrastructure Tram Track Construction Standard.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Allowance must be made for expansion and contraction of rail to control stress.In hot weather, it may be necessary to anchor the track temporarily to avoid expansion while the next section is laid or adjusted to avoid creep.
○ Each rail length shall be adjusted in accordance with the rail adjustment table and shall be anchored to standard pattern in accordance with Standard Drawing STD_T9008.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Positions and configurations shall conform to design drawings and Yarra Trams Standards and Specifications
○ Ensure bonds are sealed as per agreed method with Yarra Trams
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: CE-019-ST-0033 cl 4.5 Design Drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All welds shall be tested by qualified NDT operator
○ Failed welds shall be cut out and replaced
○ Testing documentation shall be recorded and supplied to the superintendent
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
— using the correct and complete set of drawings
— all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: To ensure lateral stability, ensure that the stress free temperature of the rail conforms to the design value (38° C).
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The preferred stress adjustment module length is 330 m. The maximum stress adjustment module length is 440 m on timber sleepers and 500 m on concrete sleepers.
○ Shorter modules are permitted if the distance between fixed points is less than 330m
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Closing weld is to be located as near as practicable to the centre of the module length (within 13.7m of centre)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Each weld must be recorded on the weld record sheet
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Mark location of closing weld.
○ Punch mark the field side of the rail head in two places a minimum of 2m clear of each side of the closing weld.
○ Measure the distance between the punch marks and record on the weld record sheet
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: If no gap exists, record zero as initial gap.
○ If there is an initial gap (incluing zero), measure and record the rail temperature at the time of preparation.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: -Measure and record the module length.
— Provide anchor blocks as shown in Figure 15 and Table 18 of NIST-2650
— Remove all clips and fastenings over the module length, to ensure free movement of rail

— Place a chalk or paint mark through the sleeper at each end of the module length (to monitor for any rail movement extending beyond module) and the quarter points of the module (to monitor for correct rail movement)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: -Ensure module is in a stress free state by using the tensor to close the gap by the distance set out in Table 19 of NIST-2650
— Lightly tap rail on the web at frequent intervals until the gap stops opening
— Check that sleepers do not lock up
— Check the quarter points to ensure rail is moving freely
○ Check to ensure there is no movement of the rail at the extreme ends of the module
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Upon completion of destressing process, record the distance between the punch marks "Punch Length After Destress"
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Measure the rail temperature and record it on the Weld Record Sheet. If rail temperature exceeds 40° C, provision of stress adjustment gap and tensing of the rail is not required.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cut the end of one rail to give the required gap, and tense the rail to provide the weld gap
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: After completing weld, wait at least 20 minutes before removing the tensor
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: When the weld has cooled, tap the rail to distribute stresses evenly and reapply clips to the module
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Remeasure the distance between punch marks and record on weld record sheet
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Measure and record the movement of quarter points
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
